text: Ugly ass purple/pink murky pour, larger white head with pink hues. Raspberry, boysenberry, tart citrus in the aroma and taste, lighter yeast note. Lighter body. Insanely drinkable.
Bottle. Ruby pink with tan head. Boysenberries, tart berries, wine and oak aromas. Flavors are dark tart berries, wine and funky flavors.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2016 Poured from a 750 ml bottle. Aroma is fairly berry forward with some light yogurt and lemon notes. Some light wheat character. Mostly an unripe blackberry character, but also some boysenberry skins. Some medium light leafy notes. There is a very green character. Pours a hazy, reddish purple with a large, moderately thick and pillowy, pinkish head that recedes to a thin film that lingers for a long time. No lacing or legs. Flavor is fairly acidic with a light sweetness. Light to moderate, phenolic, leafy character with moderate tannins from the berry skins. Quite a bit of boysenberry flavor with a bit lighter blackberry note. Light lemon and yogurt notes with a hint of wheat. Lingering berry and acid notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall, a very berry forward berliner, but I think it?s too acidic and the berry notes could be better. I think I prefer the regular Bu series to the imperial one. It?s kind of weird because the aroma has a really green berry note, but the flavor is very strongly boysenberry.

Bottle with thanks to Matt! Pours hazy magenta, medium pink purple head, dissipates fairly quickly, some lacing. Aroma is loads of Berry, raspberry,, blackberry. Flavor is light plus tart, fruity,, hints of funk. Medium body. Less acidic than most de garde bus, pleasant for sure.

On tap at De garde anniversary party. Pours out a purple ruby color with a pink ring of a head. Nose is big tart berries some jammy notes but mostly tartness. Taste is more of the nice berries mix black berry maybe some blueberries acidic pucker.
Beautiful pinkish purple pour. Nose of tart fruit and light grapes. Taste follows the nose. Tart but not acidic. Pretty full bodied. May not be traditional but damn good.

Poured a prerrt reddish purple pink color with aromas of tart blackberries, fruit skin, light wet wood, earthy bitterness and some light wheat. Flavors were mouth puckering tart berries mostly blackberries with light earthy skin and some wheat. This stuff is what make me always wanting more from these guys another solid berliner.

Bottle courtesy of GatorGuy92 & jcartamdg. Cheers, gents! Pours a hazy yellow with purple highlights. Nose is some wheat, some berry flesh, some oak, and wine. Flavor is similar oak, wheat, funk, light berry, and some wine. Light in body and a damned fine Berliner.

750 ml bottle to base-fluted de Garde geuze glass (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a very cloudy flesh plum with fizzy light cranberry head that steadily dissipates into thin lacing. Smells great! Loads of blackberry and boysenberry with a sharply pleasant lactic presence complemented nicely by an appropriate level of oak. Tastes like it smells, only much fruitier. Still fantastic, but the fruit dominates the tongue. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and lively. Excellent.

[ 75cl Bottle ][ 5oz ][ @tasting ][ $ - ? ][ Tulip ][ 07.14.15 ]Calling this a berliner weisse seems foul. Its a Sour/Wild or Fruit beer given the aggressive citric acid and lack of comparable grain. murky red chestnut, thin cream pink head, large bubbled. Musty Berry nose, moderate green fruit, chlorine, and rubber off notes. Cleaner Berry front palate, tons of fruit sweetness in the absence of acid, more citric mid-finish tingling jaw, finish is sweet. Without the acid this just comes off simple, a basic fruit beer with plenty of nose errors.

Pour is cloudy purplish ruby with a light pink head. Nose is very frozen ice pop of juice berry, off green note, sugary, a bit artificial and very simple. Flavor is also very simple, lots of that same sugary berry juice with a moderately acidic finish, not nearly as acidic as purple raz thankfully. Very sweet, fuller body, higher carb.

Murky red raspberry pour with high fizzy head. Nose is to me as all de gardes are, fantastic and better than the taste. De Garde funk, yeast and soo much fruit. Berries galore. Raspberries and blackberries and cherry and a hint of watermelon. Lemony and some acidity. Nice medium body. A little tart for my taste. Not as balanced as others from Trevor. Taste is a bit weaker than the nose. Lemons and bright acidity lead to a nice fruity palate. Fresh and underripe berries, a touch of the bitter seeds and skin. The fruit flavor goes too quickly to a acetic end. Good but not amazing.
At Jeremys with friends. Pours red with peach hint. Aroma is a littler muted. Taste is acidic berry raspberry, strawberry. I like it but too acidic.
(En fût à la brasserie): Baies profondément enracinées, bonne acidité et structure lactique. Extrêmement satisfaisante la flore de De Garde.

Aroma: Tart Red Grape, Cranberry, Boysenberry

Appearance: Reddish Ruby Hue, Passes Mild Light, Almost No Head Ring, No Lacing

Taste: Tart Red Plum, Red Grape, Boysenberry

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Tart
Pours a deep hazy purple with no head. Aroma of berries, sour wheat with a touch of funk. Taste is sour wheat, oak, berries and funk. Like a fruit smoothie.
750ml bottle. Poured a pink / purple color with a pinkish head. Berries, funky, and fruity.
Bottle. Pours purplish pink head. Nose/taste of lactose, oak, blackberry, sour funk, boysenberry - medium body.
Bottle, thanks GT2, pink pour, pink head, nose is boysenberry, taste is tart, fruity, wow

[ Bottle ][ 750mL ][ De Garde Keepers ][ $16 ][ Teku ][ 3.27.15 ]
>> Crazy opaque purple/pink pour with neon pink foam, gushing soda carbonation, slow gusher upon opening. Nose is gin botanicals, beets, berries, fresh and green plant, not one note...complex. Taste is not too sour thankfully, balanced, refreshing, some Kool-Aid, fruit punch, lime juice, beet, berry medley. Really balanced palate between sour and sweet. Really like this one, not as puckering or citric as others, great depth of flavor.
Bottle thanks to Chow. Pours a cloudy purple with small white head that lasts. The aroma is strong berry and funk. Thin mouth, tart berry, light acidity, very nice.

Poured from tap to glass. Red hue with fizzy pink head that settled. Aroma is lactic, straw, berries, yogurt. Mouthfeel is nice with medium light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness followed by a tart sourness throughout. Overall this is a very nice brew.

[2/28/15] Draught at De Garde Brewing in Tillamook. Release and bottle share event. Lovely deep red with a huge pink head. Wonderful big raspberry aroma with lacto and funk. Sour flavor, slightly sweet, juicy and lactic, with lots of berries and some funk. Rounded mouthfeel.

On tap at De Garde. Pours a bright pink purple color with a medium white head. Woody, fresh fruit nose. Dominant raspberries, some sweeter elements, sour tannins and light funk. Very drinkable. Solid.
Draft - Brine and berries. Dirty pink red with a decent white head. Fruity berry and acidic plum. Nice.
